description: {"blocks":[{"key":"bk94i","text":"Protocol detailing a Gibson-assembly-based direct cloning method for Lactiplatibacillus plantarum WCFS1. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":69,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"duee6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ftr81","text":"The last step in this version contains a supplemental video with extra context and tips, as part of the protocols.io Spotlight series, featuring conversations with protocol authors.)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":9}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0C125017647B4769AF0D75CFBBB289EC","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/in-vitro-assembly-of-plasmid-dna-for-direct-clonin-c2aiyace?step=29"}}}}

groups.title: Direct Cloning Method for L. plantarum WCFS1

journal.name: PLOS One
journal.citation: Blanch-Asensio M, Dey S, Sankaran S (2023) In vitro assembly of plasmid DNA for direct cloning in Lactiplantibacillus plantarum WCSF1. PLoS ONE 18(2): e0281625. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0281625

journals.name: PLOS One
journals.citation: Blanch-Asensio M, Dey S, Sankaran S (2023) In vitro assembly of plasmid DNA for direct cloning in Lactiplantibacillus plantarum WCSF1. PLoS ONE 18(2): e0281625. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0281625

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step:
{"blocks":[{"key":"6jrm","text":"VECTOR PCR","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjqk7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qi1o","text":"Amplify the backbone sequence of interest. Always use a high-fidelity polymerase such as Q5 polymerase. PCR parameters: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e3222","text":"          ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8d65a","text":"        - Use 10 ng of DNA as a template.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adflr","text":"        - Set the initial denaturation time to 1 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5dag","text":"        - Set the denaturation time during the cycles to 10 seconds. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ui38","text":"        - Extension: 30 sec/kb.
        - Set the final extension time to 8 minutes. 
        - 28-cycle PCR.
        - The volume of the reaction = 60 µl. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d2t6h","text":"GEL ELECTROPHORESIS ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jq2f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vhun","text":"1. Make a 1% agarose gel. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7i4m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45lmr","text":"2. Run 5 µl of each PCR on an agarose gel electrophoresis to confirm amplification at the expected size. Run the gel for 30 min at 100 V.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7gnlp","text":"DNA PURIFICATION ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"esjh9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bscdf","text":"1. Purify the PCR using the Wizard® SV Gel and PCR Clean-Up System from Promega following the protocol suggested by the manufacturer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"as940","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5u46p","text":"2. Measure the DNA concentration using a NanoDrop Microvolume UV-Vis Spectrophotometer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b3jo7","text":"INSERT PCR ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9mu3p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amldm","text":"Amplify the sequence of interest using overhang primers to add the overhang sequences at the ends of the PCR product. The length of the overhang sequences depends on the commercial kit used for the Gibson Assembly. If the HiFi Assembly Master Mix from New England Biolabs (NEB) is used, an overhang of 20 base pairs is sufficient. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9sm7v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6c246","text":"PCR parameters:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8m89n","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15qvt","text":"        - Use 10 ng of DNA as a template.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4nsie","text":"        - Set the initial denaturation time to 1 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aq3kb","text":"        - Set the denaturation time during the cycles to 10 seconds. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8jp","text":"        - Extension: 30 sec/kb.
        - Set the final extension time to 8 minutes.  
        - 28-cycle PCR.
        - The volume of the reaction = 80 µl. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"95u0i","text":"GIBSON ASSEMBLY ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0qrp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6c4l0","text":"Assemble the vector and the insert using the HiFi Assembly Master Mix from New England Biolabs (NEB). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"465po","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fshu1","text":"1. Define the amounts of vector and insert DNA required in this reaction following the protocol suggested by the manufacturer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7ses","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ff8r","text":"2. Mix the linear vector and insert DNA with overlapping DNA fragments with 10 µl of the HiFi DNA Assembly Master Mix. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bcmfe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"79ugr","text":"3. Add Milli-Q water up to 25 µl.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhfvj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4fsdl","text":"4. Incubate the reaction at 50 °C for 30 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"76hq1","text":"QUICK BLUNTING REACTION (PHOSPHORYLATION)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":41}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"851vj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45tsj","text":"Phosphorylate the 5´ends of the purified PCR products using the Quick Blunting Kit from NEB. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"binff","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"37ans","text":"1. Mix 3500 ng of the purified DNA with 2.5 µl of the 10X Quick Blunting buffer and 1 µl of the Enzyme Mix. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9d5f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dkrkr","text":"2. Add Milli-Q water up to 25 µl. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9nu7a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ige5","text":"3. Incubate the reaction first at 25 °C for 30 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"foolo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ft0em","text":"4. Incubate the reaction at 70 °C for 10 min to inactivate the enzymes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7t3d1","text":"LIGATION","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rd6a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eg53g","text":"Ligate the phosphorylated products using the T4 Ligase enzyme from NEB. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bkegi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c59ei","text":"1. Mix 500 ng of the phosphorylated DNA (3.6 µl of the Quick Blunting reaction) with 1.5 µl of T4 Ligase and 2.5 µl of 10X T4 Ligase Buffer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35jc4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2frd","text":"2. Add Milli-Q water up to 25 µl. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"53o36","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ojot","text":"3. Incubate the reaction first at 25 °C for 2.5 hours. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6d6ns","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3soma","text":"4. Incubate the reaction at 70 °C for 10 min to inactivate the enzymes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e9ls1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dldkj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6o1a0","text":"The number of ligation reactions differs based on the amount of DNA that is desired to be circularized. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cjn98","text":"DNA PURIFICATION ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f69n7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2s4d0","text":"1. Purify the PCR using the Wizard® SV Gel and PCR Clean-Up System from Promega following the protocol suggested by the manufacturer except for the elution step. Perform the elution three times (each time with 9 µl of Mili-Q water) in order to concentrate the ligated product. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2d173","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ftk8j","text":"2. Measure the DNA concentration using a NanoDrop Microvolume UV-Vis Spectrophotometer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47ob","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"did8r","text":"DNA is ready to be transformed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"elasp","text":"COLONY PCR FOR SEQUENCE VERIFICATION","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7pmih","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6teah","text":"1. Label the colonies to be screened on the plate. For each colony, take half of the colony using a sterile pipette tip.         - Set the initial denaturation time to 10 minutes.

Manually discard the supernatant. Scratched off the residual pellet fraction with a sterile pipette tip","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7hv5d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpihn","text":"4. Perform the PCR in this tube. Same PCR parameters as before. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ol94","text":"SANGER SEQUENCING ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ck0vv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f4n1v","text":"1. Send at least 1200 ng of purified DNA for sequencing. Higher amounts of DNA result in a better reading. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7i3o6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b047t","text":"2. Request an additional DNA purification step by the sequencing company (Eurofins Genomics). Additional Service: PCR Purification. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7s5kr","text":"INOCULATION","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cm1nm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c64oj","text":"Take the remaining half of the colony and inoculate it into 5 mL of MRS media supplemented with 10 μg/mL of erythromycin. {"blocks":[{"key":"be6vn","text":"GLYCEROL STOCK","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cp6cs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"br5od","text":"Mix 750 µl of the overnight culture with 250 µl of 60% glycerol. Store the tube at -80 °C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7f4v6","text":"INCUBATION","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8lrh3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3tspf","text":"Incubate the plate at 37 °C for 48 h for colonies to grow. {"blocks":[{"key":"f0m6i","text":"PLATING ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"96ha9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15ud5","text":"1. After the incubation, centrifuge the cells at 4000 rpm (3363 X g) for 5 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"91uem","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"in9u","text":"2. Discard the 800 μL of the supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bdqe9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cfgac","text":"3. Resuspend the remaining 200 μL by slow pipetting. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6hb2g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"21i0j","text":"4. Plate the resuspended pellet on an MRS Agar plate supplemented with 10 μg/mL of Erythromycin. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8tcjl","text":"INCUBATION","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"368ta","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2a2rg","text":"Incubate the bacteria at 37 °C and 250 rpm for 3 h to allow the expression of antibiotic resistance genes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bplff","text":"ASSEMBLED PRODUCT PCR","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgq4o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dva6n","text":"Amplify the assembled product by PCR. Use a high-fidelity PCR such as Q5 polymerase. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27e7k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"77ctj","text":"1. Design primers that anneal to the insert and cover the whole assembled plasmid. An especially good set of primers is needed for this reaction. Properly check the primers with a primer design tool. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fadtd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"790gg","text":"2. Use 5 µl of the HiFi Assembly reaction as a template for amplification. PCR parameters: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6fo4a","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjk0i","text":"        - Set the initial denaturation time to 2 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dfjom","text":"        - Set the denaturation time during the cycles to 10 seconds. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhas5","text":"        - Extension: 30 sec/kb.
        - Set the final extension time to 8 minutes. 
        - 23-cycle PCR.
        - The volume of the reaction = 120 µl. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cqgmi","text":"ELECTROPORATION ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cu4ch","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"argtr","text":"1. Mix the plasmid DNA (300 – 1200 ng) with 60 µl of freshly prepared electrocompetent cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6rhmf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7alh3","text":"2. Incubate the mixture on ice for 10 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4cmh2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ksi9","text":"3. Transfer the mixture to an ice-cold electroporation cuvette with a 2 mm gap (Bio-Rad Laboratories GmbH). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4vsf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2rj0j","text":"4. Insert the cuvette in the MicroPulser Electroporator (Bio-Rad Laboratories GmbH, Germany). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"596si","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ac321","text":"5. Apply a single pulse (5 ms) at 1.8 kV.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fggtn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f12h5","text":"6. Add immediately 1 mL of room-temperature MRS media after the pulse.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"58dmq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5umjb","text":"7. Transfer the mixture into a 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32tns","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"savc","text":"INOCULATION WILD-TYPE BACTERIA ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2gqqk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a7t70","text":"Inoculate Wild-type L. plantarum WCFS1 from glycerol stock in 5 mL of MRS media. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":20,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ais96","text":"INCUBATION INITIAL CULTURE","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4dlv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5odn7","text":"Incubate the bacterial culture overnight and at 37 °C with shaking (250 rpm). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6rhrg","text":"SECONDARY CULTURE","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4hsot","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"80se8","text":"After approximately 16h, add 1 mL of the culture (OD600 = 2) to 20 mL of MRS media and 5 mL of 1% (w/v) glycine. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5jvsl","text":"INCUBATION SECONDARY CULTURE","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dnmkv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f7ore","text":"Incubate this secondary culture for roughly 4 h at 37 °C and 250 rpm until OD600 reached 0.8.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ld3t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"du2nk","text":"WASHINGS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4bv9p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4u1f","text":"1. Harvest the cells by centrifugation at 4000 rpm (3363 X g) for 12 min at 4°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fosct","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9591","text":"2. Manually discard the supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bb6c9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5d2ao","text":"3. Wash the pellet twice with 5 mL of ice-cold 10 mM MgCl2. Each time centrifuge cells at 4000 rpm (3363 X g) for 10 min at 4°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ena6o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8bfk8","text":"4. Wash the pellet twice (first with 5 mL and then with 1 mL) with ice-cold Suc/Gly solution (1 M sucrose and 10% (v/v) glycerol mixed in a 1:1 (v/v) ratio). Each time centrifuge cells at 4000 rpm (3363 X g) for 10 min at 4°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"anai9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5hecc","text":"5. Manually discard the supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4rd3s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"clrc6","text":"6. Resuspend the bacterial pellet in 450 μL of ice-cold Sac/Gly solution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cr5lc","text":"ALIQUOTING ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"83o9d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e9bp6","text":"1. Make aliquotes of 60 uL each. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5e9au","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c111q","text":"2. Immediately store at -80 °C the aliquots that are not going to be used. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7tj87","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"84si6","text":"3. Keep the aliquots that are going to be used for the transformation on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"23rtp","text":"INCUBATION","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ntab","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"osp0","text":"Incubate the culture overnight at 37 °C with shaking (250 rpm).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ahed8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"889hb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4l1t0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"embed","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"code":"\u003ciframe title=\"YouTube video player\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/6whNwW0sW2o?si=_eeIclkzRDq1kffW\" height=\"315\" width=\"560\"\u003e\u003c/iframe\u003e"}}}}
